Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of unhealthy immune systems in causing harm and death from viruses.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence or support to back up its assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that viruses do not harm or kill humans, which contradicts established scientific knowledge.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that pathogenic viruses can infect any human cell and cause harm, regardless of the state of the immune system.
Understate: The claim understates the role of the immune system in responding to viral infections and suggests that it is solely responsible for causing harm and death.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation by stating that humans become sick due to a normal reaction of the immune system against infection, which is how the immune system is supposed to work.
